definitions.definition: that you cannot avoid or prevent

examples.text: It was an inevitable consequence of the decision.
It was inevitable that there would be job losses.
A rise in interest rates seems inevitable.
The scandal made her resignation inevitable.
They came to see defeat as inevitable.

definitions.definition: happening so often that you always expect it

examples.text: the English and their inevitable cups of tea

definitions.definition: something that is certain to happen

examples.text: You have to accept the inevitable.
The inevitable happened—I forgot my passport.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin inevitabilis, from in- ‘not’ + evitabilis ‘avoidable’ (from evitare ‘avoid’).
